link.synopsis: Musician Guy Lambert (Elvis Presley) is chased by women, smugglers and detectives in this comedy with a European backdrop. While performing in Britain, Lambert catches the eye of an heiress, Jill (Annette Day). Jill follows Guy to Belgium, much to the dismay of her uncle (John Williams), who in turn follows Jill. When thieves hide stolen jewels in Guy's luggage, he finds himself hotly pursued by the authorities -- and another desirous female.
link.title: synopsis
Live a Little, Love a Little
It Happened at the World's Fair
Elvis Presley: From the Beginning to the End
Elvis: The Birth of Rock N' Roll
Good Rockin' Tonight: The Legacy of Sun Records
Frank Sinatra Show: Welcome Home Elvis
How to Stuff a Wild Bikini
Lost Concerts Series: Presley & Cash: The Road Show

link.synopsis: Little-known facts about the 1960s television series "The Munsters" abound in this documentary that details the show's conception, development and success through cast and crew interviews, rare footage and scenes from the show. The program, which details the behind-the-scenes antics of the classic hit comedy, also includes biographical documentaries of actors Fred Gwynne, Yvonne De Carlo and Al Lewis.
link.title: synopsis
Return to the Bat Cave: The Misadventures of Adam and Burt
Pittsburgh Pirates 1979 World Series Collector's Edition
The I Love Lucy 50th Anniversary Special
Tony Orlando & Dawn: The Ultimate Collection
Married... with Children: The Most Outrageous Episodes: Vol. 2
One Day at a Time: Season 1
Munster, Go Home! / The Munsters' Revenge
The Funny Blokes of British Comedy
I Love Lucy: Lucy's Really Lost Moments
The Funny World of Lucy: Vol. 2
The Jack Benny Show: Collector's Edition
The Adventures of Ozzie and Harriet: Vol. 9
The Golden Age of TV Comedy

title.regular: The Munsters: America's First Family of Fright
title.short: Munsters: America's First Family of Fright

link.synopsis: Beatlemania hits Manhattan in director Robert Zemeckis's debut film. The comedy follows six teens on the day of the Beatles' 1964 premiere on "The Ed Sullivan Show." Bride-to-be Pam (Nancy Allen) wants a night of passion with one of the Fab Four; photographer Grace (Teresa Saldana) hopes to take the photo of her career; Rosie (Wendy Jo Sperber) and Richard (Eddie Deezen) are hysterical fans; and the other two are out to ruin the mop-tops' show.
link.title: synopsis
Reel Talent: First Films by Legendary Directors
The Hudson Brothers Razzle Dazzle Show: The Complete Series
A Hard Day's Night: Collector's Series
Composing the Beatles Songbook: Lennon and McCartney: 1966-1970
Romy and Michele's High School Reunion
The Rutles 2: Can't Buy Me Lunch
Girls Just Want to Have Fun

link.synopsis: Released by Ealing Studios after World War II, director Charles Crichton's rib tickler captures the "take charge" spirit of many Brits. When British Railways announces the closure of the Titfield line, citizens try to run it themselves -- but the local bus company is out to shut down the competition. With money and pride at stake, the battle lines are drawn in this boisterous comedy starring Stanley Holloway, George Relph and Naunton Wayne.
link.title: synopsis
The Man in the White Suit
The Englishman Who Went Up a Hill but Came Down a Mountain
There's No Business Like Show Business
The Bridge on the River Kwai

link.synopsis: A goofball air traffic controller (Chevy Chase) is imbued with some wacky telekinetic powers after an unfortunate (or fortunate, for the sake of this comedy!) collision with a nuclear-waste truck. In a misguided attempt to win back his girlfriend, he uses his newfound abilities to harass her suitors -- who are lining up in droves to date her. Dabney Coleman, Patti D'Arbanville and Brian Doyle-Murray costar. Ken Shapiro directs.
link.title: synopsis
The Adventures of Buckaroo Banzai Across the 8th Dimension
The Man with One Red Shoe

link.synopsis: Good salesmen can move any merchandise -- theoretically, at least. But what if the product is an ungodly amount of frozen beef? Leave it to door-to-door hucksters Maurice (Ray Romano) and Dave (Kevin James) to get the job done, even if they have to pull every trick in the book to make quota; if they fail, they could end up as … dead meat. Sofía Vergara, Kim Coates, Caroline Aaron and Donzaleigh Abernathy costar in this sizzling comedy.
link.title: synopsis
I Now Pronounce You Chuck and Larry
Confessions of a Sociopathic Social Climber

link.synopsis: This BBC comedy series features future "Absolutely Fabulous" writer-actress Jennifer Saunders and "Vicar of Dibley" star Dawn French. In a series of sketches, they poke fun at everything from American television to pop-culture icons to foreign film. Nothing is safe from French and Saunders's skewering wit: Mel Gibson and Ingmar Bergman, "Baywatch" and Batman, Dr. Quinn and Björk all receive serious spoofing in this hilarious show.
link.title: synopsis
French & Saunders: Back with a Vengeance
French & Saunders: Gentlemen Prefer French & Saunders
The Life and Times of Vivienne Vyle
The Vicar of Dibley: 10th Anniversary Specials
The Vicar of Dibley: A Holy Wholly Happy Ending
The Best of So Graham Norton
A Bit of Fry and Laurie
Rufus Wainwright: Rufus! Rufus! Rufus! Does Judy! Judy! Judy!: Live
Knowing Me Knowing You with Alan Partridge: The Complete Series
The League of Gentlemen: Christmas Special
The Dame Edna Experience: The Christmas Specials
The Thin Blue Line: The Complete Lineup

title.regular: French & Saunders: Living in a Material World

link.synopsis: In his first horror movie, The Invisible Man Returns, Vincent Price stars as the titular gent you can "see right through" when he goes undercover to clear his name of a murder charge. Costars Cedric Hardwicke; Joe May directs. In The Invisible Woman, a nutty professor (John Barrymore) transforms a model (Virginia Bruce) into an invisible woman, and that gets the mob interested! Contains great comedy gags directed by A. Edward Sutherland.
link.title: synopsis
The Man Who Changed His Mind
The Fly 2: Return of the Fly
The First Films of Samuel Fuller: The Baron of Arizona
Mr. Sardonicus / The Old Dark House
I Met Him in Paris / Bluebeard's Eighth Wife
The Invisible Agent / The Invisible Man's Revenge
Son of Dracula / House of Dracula
Son of Frankenstein / Ghost of Frankenstein
The Mummy's Hand / The Mummy's Tomb
Zontar: Thing from Venus / The Eye Creatures
The Mummy's Ghost / The Mummy's Curse
Tales of Terror / Twice Told Tales
Deanna Durbin: Three Smart Girls / Something in the Wind
The First Films of Samuel Fuller: I Shot Jesse James
The Wolf Man / Frankenstein Meets the Wolf Man
Irene Dunne Romance Classics: Love Affair / Penny Serenade

title.regular: The Invisible Man Returns / The Invisible Woman

link.synopsis: Middle-aged widower Dr. Charley Nichols (Walter Matthau) treads the scary waters of the dating scene and tries to be a suave swinger -- but feels more like a fish out of water in this hilarious comedy. Yet his luck changes when he meets divorcée Ann (Glenda Jackson). The two engage in a comical courtship in which neither will commit to a serious relationship. At the same time, Charley butts heads with a fellow doctor (Art Carney).
link.title: synopsis
A Guide for the Married Man
The Taking of Pelham One Two Three
Won Ton Ton: The Dog Who Saved Hollywood

link.synopsis: Sexy widow Stella Johnson (Barbara Eden) shakes up the small town of Harper Valley in this satirical suburban comedy. Forced out of town by the disapproving PTA ladies for her tight tops and miniskirts, Stella plots revenge against her foes. Trusting that everyone has their dirty secrets, the spunky lady retaliates with some scandalous photos of Harper Valley's most self-righteous citizens. Nanette Fabray, Louis Nye and Pat Paulsen co-star.
link.title: synopsis
Kenny Rogers: Coward of the County
The Adventures of Ma & Pa Kettle: Vol. 1
Married... with Children: The Most Outrageous Episodes: Vol. 2
Monty Python's And Now for Something Completely Different
Five on the Black Hand Side
If It's Tuesday, This Must Be Belgium

link.synopsis: Based on a Chinese short story, this dark comedy set in 1920s Ireland centers on Harry Maloney (Colm Meaney), a bitter man in search of a purpose after the death of his wife and son. So Maloney sets out to destroy pub owner and town matchmaker George O'Flaherty (Adrian Dunbar). But when Maloney requires O'Flaherty to broker a marriage for his handsome but dimwitted son (Cillian Murphy), his irrational hatred for the man doubles.
link.title: synopsis
The Boys and Girl from County Clare
The Wind That Shakes the Barley
How to Kill Your Neighbor's Dog

link.synopsis: Take a hilarious walk down memory lane with this laugh-filled collection -- which is part documentary and part concert video -- featuring some of the most memorable early appearances by America's top black comedians. As funnymen Chris Rock, Arsenio Hall, D.L. Hughley, Steve Harvey and George Wallace take the stage, they display the sharp wit and flawless timing that would later make them rulers of the comedy kingdom.
link.title: synopsis
Why We Laugh: Black Comedians on Black Comedy
Shaquille O'Neal Presents: All Star Comedy Jam: Live from South Beach
The Big Black Comedy Show: Vol. 1
Platinum Comedy Series: The Torry Brothers: A Family Affair
We Don't Die, We Multiply: The Robin Harris Story
Best of Platinum Comedy Series: Vol. 1
Just for Laughs: Stand-Up: Vol. 1: Best of the Uptown Comics
Platinum Comedy Series: The Good, The Badd, The Funny
The Big Black Comedy Show: Vol. 4
Robin Harris: Live from the Comedy Act Theater
I Think I Love My Wife
Dave Chappelle: For What It's Worth
Katt Williams: The Pimp Chronicles: Pt. 1
Comedy Express: B.T.: I'm Not Black Enough
Latham Entertainment Presents: An All New Comedy Experience
The Big Black Comedy Show: Vol. 2
Alonzo Bodden: Tall, Dark and Funny
Living Legends of Comedy: Real Talk

link.synopsis: In writer-director Michael Whaley's smart and sexy comedy, urban co-workers Michael (Whaley) and Stacey (Gina Torres) are forced to cohabitate as roommates, only to discover that they have more in common than they once believed. Their mutual attraction builds, but will their devotion to the rigid "rules" of dating -- and the practice of playing silly games -- serve to ruin their romantic potential?
link.title: synopsis
A Good Man Is Hard to Find
Love and Other Four Letter Words

link.synopsis: For the 10 interns who sign up to be part of the online dating site BestMatch.mate, spending their summer playing Cupid turns out to be very different than they expected -- from the rash of crazy clients to the interns' own interpersonal problems. Shoentel Scott, Dennis Addison and Victoria Esher co-star in this independent romantic comedy directed by husband-and-wife team Carl and Vivian Adams.
link.title: synopsis
Black Woman's Guide to Getting Married
Black Woman's Guide to Finding a Good Man
What Kind of Love Is This?
I'm Doing the Right Thing with the Wrong Man
I Think I Love My Wife
Keepin' the Faith: Lookin' for Mr. Right
Tyler Perry's I Can Do Bad All by Myself

link.synopsis: When bride-to-be Elise (Amy Adams) and her fiance (Adam Garcia) gather their erstwhile college friends for a pre-wedding wingding and reunion, it sets the stage for confrontations, revelations and rekindled romances in this ensemble comedy from director Matthew Cole Weiss. The happy couple's guests include wacky actress Lana (Mena Suvari), hard-drinking Simon (James Van Der Beek) and Elise's sour ex-roommate (Lauren German).
link.title: synopsis
Sex and Lies in Sin City
Miss Pettigrew Lives for a Day
You Will Meet a Tall Dark Stranger
Once Upon a Time in the Midlands

link.synopsis: After five years of marriage, Susan (Lucille Ball) and Lorenzo (Desi Arnaz) are drifting apart. So when he plans a camping trip to test a new insecticide he's developing, she vows to come along and keep him company. Little does Lorenzo know that Susan's guardian angel (James Mason) is tagging along, too. This offbeat romantic comedy hit theaters during the fifth season of "I Love Lucy," capitalizing on America's love affair with its stars.
link.title: synopsis
I Love Lucy: The Movie and Other Great Rarities
Sorrowful Jones / The Paleface: Double Feature
The I Love Lucy 50th Anniversary Special
If You Could Only Cook / Too Many Husbands
The Adventures of Ma & Pa Kettle: Vol. 1
Cat on a Hot Tin Roof
The Last Time I Saw Paris

link.synopsis: Jeremy Piven and Jami Gertz star as parents who plan an over-the-top bar mitzvah for their 13-year-old son, while the boy struggles with his own shyness and his desire to see his father and grandfather reconcile. Directed by Scott Marshall, who deftly mocks Hollywood excess, this sharp but loving satire of materialism took home the Best Feature award at the U.S. Comedy Arts Festival. Doris Roberts, Larry Miller and newcomer Daryl Sabara co-star.
link.title: synopsis
Me and You and Everyone We Know
Marilyn Hotchkiss Ballroom Dancing and Charm School
That's the Way I Like It

link.synopsis: In director Daniel Mann's interpretation of John Patrick's Broadway comedy, American Col. Purdy (Paul Ford) is determined to infuse post-World War II Okinawans with Western culture -- and assigns the hapless Capt. Fisby (Glenn Ford) to make it so. Instead, the natives convince pushover Fisby to help them build a geisha teahouse, for which he enlists the help of interpreter Sakima (Marlon Brando). The film earned six Golden Globe nominations.
link.title: synopsis

category.label: Best Actor in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee
category.term: Best Actor in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee

category.label: Best Actor in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee
category.term: Best Actor in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee

category.label: Best Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee
category.term: Best Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee

category.label: Best Actress in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee
category.term: Best Actress in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee

category.label: Best Supporting Actor in a Motion Picture nominee
category.term: Best Supporting Actor in a Motion Picture nominee

link.title: Appointment in Honduras / Escape to Burma: Double Feature
Deanna Durbin: Three Smart Girls / Something in the Wind
The Last Time I Saw Archie
I Was a Male War Bride
Anna and the King of Siam
Who's Been Sleeping in My Bed?
Dim Sum: A Little Bit of Heart

title.regular: The Teahouse of the August Moon
title.short: The Teahouse of the August Moon

link.synopsis: Bad-boy wannabe John "Rugged" Rudgate (Aaron Stanford) fancies himself a criminal, yet his exploits amount to little more than counterfeiting rebate coupons. He soon teams with his dim friend (Paul Schneider) and his sister (Zooey Deschanel) to launch an ill-conceived heist in this droll indie comedy. Two small-town cops (Michael Rapaport and Kevin Dunn) and a goofy hardware store clerk (Judah Friedlander) complicate Rugged's already-doomed plan.
link.title: synopsis
Trailer Park Boys: Countdown to Liquor Day

link.synopsis: When Caroline's (Esther Williams) wedding to Steve (Red Skelton) is interrupted by a woman claiming to be Steve's wife, the furious bride returns to single life as a college swim instructor. Attempting to win her back, Steve enrolls as the school's only male student. Williams gets a chance to show off her aquatic skills in her first major film role in director George Sidney's song-filled romantic comedy. Basil Rathbone co-stars.
link.title: synopsis
Take Me Out to the Ball Game
Deanna Durbin: It Started with Eve / Can't Help Singing

link.synopsis: Dynamic career woman and single mother Julie (Vanessa L. Williams) considers herself fulfilled in her job and her relationship with a loving boyfriend. But when she decides to seek out the sperm donor who fathered her 6-year-old son, Jake (Jeremy Gumbs), everything changes. The donor, Paul (Kevin Daniels), shakes up her life in ways she never expected. Eartha Kitt, Ben Vereen and Michael Boatman co-star in this delightful romantic comedy.
link.title: synopsis
Soul Theater Series: The Fabric of a Man
Keepin' the Faith: Lookin' for Mr. Right
The 2006 Academy Award Short Films Collection

link.synopsis: Shocked by the premature death of a closeted former classmate, two gay friends, Mel (Steven Lim) and Ash (Chowee Leow) are forced to reexamine the state of their own lives and ponder what the future holds. Troubled by the idea of growing old alone, the pair embarks on a quest to find love and happiness with the dream men they're sure await them both. Writer-director Ray Yeung's outrageous comedy also stars Gareth Rhys Davis and Neil Collie.
link.title: synopsis
The Mostly Unfabulous Social Life of Ethan Green

link.synopsis: Beloved comedy duo Dean Martin and Jerry Lewis team up for hilarity in this pair of wacky classics directed by Hal Walker. First, a former college All-American football hero hires a genial jock (Martin) to toughen up his wimpy son (Lewis) in That's My Boy. Then, a hapless Navy recruit (Lewis) and a sophisticated officer (Martin) create chaos on their submarine in Sailor Beware. A young James Dean appears as a fellow sailor.
link.title: synopsis
Don't Raise the Bridge, Lower the River
My Friend Irma / My Friend Irma Goes West
Dean Martin & Jerry Lewis: Vol. 2: When Television Was Funny
Dean Martin & Jerry Lewis: Vol. 3: Still Laughing
How to Save a Marriage and Ruin Your Life / Who Was That Lady?
Martin & Lewis: At War with the Army
The Three Stooges: All the World's a Stooge
Martin & Lewis: Colgate Comedy Hour III & IV
I Was a Male War Bride
The Ealing Comedy Collection: Whisky Galore
W.C. Fields Comedy Collection: The Bank Dick

link.synopsis: Join beloved stand-up star Sinbad as he shares his comedic talents in this hilarious 1998 concert, filmed live at the Guillermo P. Trinidad Memorial Stadium in Aruba for HBO's "Comedy Hour." The award-winning comedian and actor offers his unique viewpoints on raising kids, vacations, relationships, water sports, music and more.
link.title: synopsis
Sinbad: Son of a Preacher Man
Robin Harris: Live from the Comedy Act Theater
Cedric the Entertainer: Taking You Higher
Steve Harvey: Don't Trip, He Ain't Through with Me Yet
Just for Laughs: Stand-Up: Vol. 1: Best of the Uptown Comics
Whoopi: Back on Broadway: The 20th Anniversary
Shaquille O'Neal Presents: All Star Comedy Jam: Live from South Beach
George Carlin: It's Bad for Ya
Jamie Foxx: I Might Need Security
Jamie Foxx Unleashed: Lost, Stolen and Leaked!
The Original Latin Kings of Comedy
National Lampoon Live: New Faces: Vol. 1
John Pinette: I Say Nay Nay
Andy Kaufman: I'm from Hollywood/My Breakfast with Blassie
National Lampoon Live: New Faces: Vol. 2
National Lampoon Live: The International Show
Dane Cook: Rough Around the Edges: Live from Madison Square Garden
Outlaugh: The Best of Queer Comedy
Comedy Express: B.T.: I'm Not Black Enough
Larry the Cable Guy: Morning Constitutions

link.synopsis: Dick Van Dyke stars as Lt. Robin Crusoe in this family comedy about a Navy pilot who becomes marooned in shark-infested seas on a tiny raft, only to wash up on an island of unique castaways -- including a poker-playing chimpanzee. Crusoe soon befriends Wednesday, a young native woman who's been exiled to the island for rebelling against her overprotective father. It's not long before the two get into every kind of high jinks imaginable.
link.title: synopsis
Around the World in 80 Days: Special Edition
The Island at the Top of the World
The Horse in the Gray Flannel Suit

link.synopsis: After saving the life of a research laboratory duck and bringing the bird home to live with him and his family, down-on-his-luck professor Albert Dooley (Dean Jones) is thrilled to discover that, due to X-ray exposure, the duck lays golden eggs. But what seems a stroke of good fortune soon becomes a major problem when greedy neighbors and the government get wind of the duck's invaluable talent. Sandy Duncan co-stars in this family comedy.
link.title: synopsis

category.label: Best Actor in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee
category.term: Best Actor in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee

link.title: Now You See Him, Now You Don't
The Horse in the Gray Flannel Suit
The Strongest Man in the World
Cloudy with a Chance of Meatballs
Wallace & Gromit: The Curse of the Were-Rabbit
The Apple Dumpling Gang Rides Again

link.synopsis: For young Takahashi Mayumi, life at the Toenail of Satan's Spartan Institute of Higher Education is never easy: The boarding school is run by sadistic sexual deviants. Luckily, Takahashi has a guardian angel: foxy superhero Kekko Kamen. Wearing nothing but her red boots, gloves and a mask, Kekko battles the school's predatory staff using only her sick fighting skills and her curvaceous body in this anime comedy.
link.title: synopsis
Spike and Mike's Sick & Twisted Festival of Animation: Full Frontal
Fencer of Minerva: Vol. 2: The Tempest
Ah My Buddha: Vol. 1: The Aroused One
Ah My Buddha: Vol. 6: The Six Realms Below
Burn Up Excess: Vol. 1: To Serve and Protect
Agent Aika Anime Legends: Re-Mastered Complete Collection
Urusei Yatsura Ova 1: Inaba the Dreammaker
Lupin the 3rd: The Castle of Cagliostro: Special Edition
Urusei Yatsura Movie 3: Remember My Love
Tenchi the Movie 2: The Daughter of Darkness
Ninja Nonsense: The Legend of Shinobu

link.synopsis: When an innovative health care company unveils RoboDoc, an android physician so carefully programmed it cannot make a medical mistake, a greedy medical malpractice lawyer (Kenny Babel) sees a threat to his livelihood, not a miracle. He'll stop at nothing to see RoboDoc reduced to a heap of wires and software. Stephen Maddocks directs this medical comedy that also stars Alan Thicke, David Faustino and William Haze.
link.title: synopsis
National Lampoon Presents: One, Two, Many
National Lampoon's Ratko: The Dictator's Son
National Lampoon Presents: The Beach Party at the Threshold of Hell
Jay and Silent Bob Strike Back
Shriek If You Know What I Did Last Friday the 13th
South Park: Bigger, Longer and Uncut
You Don't Mess with the Zohan

link.synopsis: Thrown out of his mansion by his soon-to-be ex-trophy wife, Barbara (Janine Turner), Dallas businessman Max Hagan (Tom Wilkinson) forges an unlikely connection with punk rocker Raff (Nick Stahl), the boyfriend of his workaholic daughter, Beth (Selma Blair). Joining Raff for a wild night on the town, Max abandons his thoroughly dysfunctional life and gets in touch with his inner punk in this rollicking comedy from writer-director Amy Talkington.
link.title: synopsis
The Boys and Girls Guide to Getting Down

title.regular: The Night of the White Pants
title.short: The Night of the White Pants

link.synopsis: Comedian and radio talk show personality Jim Norton hosts this no-holds-barred HBO comedy showcase, filmed before a raucous audience in New Jersey's Bergen Performing Arts Center and featuring outrageous routines by the likes of Andrew Dice Clay. Other top-notch comedians offering adults-only entertainment include Jim Florentine, Louis Katz, Bill Burr, Anthony Jeselnik, Jacob Sirof, Ari Shaffir, Patrice O'Neal and many more.
link.title: synopsis
Just for Laughs: Stand-Up: Over the Edge
Meet the Creeps: Outrageous Hidden Camera Comedy
Jim Jefferies: I Swear to God
Andrew Dice Clay: One Night with Dice
Just for Laughs: Stand-Up: Vol. 2: On the Edge
Jim Breuer: Let's Clear the Air
Jamie Foxx Presents: America's Funniest Comics: Vol. 1
Artie Lange: It's the Whiskey Talkin'
Patton Oswalt: My Weakness Is Strong
Karen Williams: I Need a Snack
Jeff Dunham's Very Special Christmas Special
Aisha Tyler Is Lit: Live at the Fillmore
Dane Cook: Rough Around the Edges: Live from Madison Square Garden
Bobby Jones: Comedy All Stars: Vol. 1
Outlaugh: The Best of Queer Comedy
Comics on Duty: We Love You, Mrs. Bevins
Jamie Foxx Presents: America's Funniest Comics: Vol. 3
Anjelah Johnson: That's How We Do It
Frank Caliendo: All Over the Place
Jason Stuart: Making It to the Middle

link.synopsis: This award-winning German comedy stars Edgar Selge as Wolfgang Zenker, a traveling fashion salesman who loses his driver's license. Refusing to surrender his customers to a younger rival (Roman Knizka), Wolfgang hires his son, Karsten (Florian Bartholomäi), as a chauffeur. But the plan backfires in a big way when Karsten comes out of the closet and falls in love with his father's main competitor. Ingo Rasper directs.
link.title: synopsis
Otto; or, Up With Dead People

link.synopsis: While various university fraternities and sororities train for several months for an important step show competition, a madcap combination of romances, rehearsals and Greek initiations unfolds. Filmed at Prairie View A&M University in Texas, this Michael Taliferro-directed comedy features amazing dance sequences and an unbeatable soundtrack. Stars such as Mo'Nique, Anthony Anderson, James Avery, Dick Gregory and Faizon Love make appearances.
link.title: synopsis
You Got Served: Take It to the Streets
Tyler Perry's Why Did I Get Married Too?
Tyler Perry's Madea Goes to Jail
Luke and Brie Are on a First Date
I Do: How to Get Married and Stay Single
The Mostly Unfabulous Social Life of Ethan Green

link.synopsis: When God calls, you answer, even if it means carrying a child for two men when you're a married Christian conservative from the South. Worlds collide when one of the dads (Orlando Jones) descends on the mom (A.J. Cook) to "manage" the pregnancy in this comedy. With the African American choreographer and dad-to-be refusing to budge from the surrogate's home, her very Southern community and anti-gay marriage hubby are in a tizzy.
link.title: synopsis
Edie & Thea: A Very Long Engagement

link.synopsis: Several diplomats' daughters are drawn into international intrigue and murder in 13 Frightened Girls. Then, in 13 Ghosts, a man (Charles Herbert) inherits his uncle's mansion and stumbles upon spirits that are only visible to guests who wear special goggles. Horror maestro and iconic showman William Castle stirs a splash of comedy into his suspenseful concoctions in this pair of classic 1960s chillers.
link.title: synopsis
Mr. Sardonicus / The Old Dark House
The Masque of the Red Death / The Premature Burial
Spine Tingler! The William Castle Story
House of Wax / The Mystery of the Wax Museum
Night of the Demon / Curse of the Demon
The Black Room / The Man They Couldn't Hang
Die, Monster, Die! / The Dunwich Horror: Double Feature
The Tomb of Ligeia / An Evening of Edgar Allen Poe
Dead Eyes of London / The Ghost
The Premature Burial / The Man with the X-Ray Eyes
Del Tenney Double Feature: The Horror of Party Beach/The Curse of the Living Corpse
The Torture Chamber of Dr. Sadism / Death Smiles on a Murderer
Doctor of Doom / The Wrestling Women vs. The Aztec Mummy: Double Feature
Drive-in Double Feature: Creation of the Humanoids / War Between the Planets
The Curse of the Mummy's Tomb / The Two Faces of Dr. Jekyll

link.synopsis: This live-action version of the classic children's story stars Colin Ford as Jack, a student flunking out of fairy tale school who trades his computer for some beans that a pawnbroker (Wallace Shawn) swears will make him worthy of fairy tale legend. When the seeds grow into a mighty beanstalk, Jack and his pal, Jillian (Chloe Moretz), climb into the clouds where a giant guards a magic harp. Gary J. Tunnicliffe directs this family-friendly comedy.
link.title: synopsis
The New Adventures of Pippi Longstocking
The Adventures of Elmo in Grouchland
Tom and Jerry Meet Sherlock Holmes
The True Story of Puss 'n Boots
Tinker Bell and the Great Fairy Rescue
Cloudy with a Chance of Meatballs
The Neverending Story 3: Escape From Fantasia

link.synopsis: Feisty comedienne Kathy Griffin dishes plenty of dirt on numerous Hollywood celebs in a laugh out loud stand-up performance, which features pointed attacks on Barbara Walters, Britney Spears, Miley Cyrus and Jon and Kate Gosselin. This hilarious comedy special also includes Griffin spilling juicy details on her experience taking Levi Johnston, the father of Bristol Palin's baby, to the Teen Choice Awards.
link.title: synopsis
Kathy Griffin: She'll Cut a Bitch
Kathy Griffin: My Life on the D-List
Just for Laughs: Stand-Up: Over the Edge
Patton Oswalt: My Weakness Is Strong
Anjelah Johnson: That's How We Do It
Charlie Murphy: I Will Not Apologize
Karen Williams: I Need a Snack
Leslie Jordan: My Trip Down the Pink Carpet: Live in Atlanta
Denis Leary and Friends Present: Douchebags & Donuts
Jeff Dunham's Very Special Christmas Special
Aisha Tyler Is Lit: Live at the Fillmore
Dane Cook: Rough Around the Edges: Live from Madison Square Garden
Bobby Jones: Comedy All Stars: Vol. 1
Outlaugh: The Best of Queer Comedy
Comics on Duty: We Love You, Mrs. Bevins
Jamie Foxx Presents: America's Funniest Comics: Vol. 3
Frank Caliendo: All Over the Place
Jason Stuart: Making It to the Middle
Steven Wright: When the Leaves Blow Away
Suzanne Westenhoefer: A Bottom on Top
Tess: Looking for My Next Ex-Husband

link.synopsis: Laid-back Egyptian American comic Ahmed Ahmed breaks down the "Arabic concept," Swingers style, in this film tour through the Middle East, wielding the global currency of comedy to skewer stereotypes of Arabs and Jews alike. Whether in nouveau Dubai or historic Riyadh, New York or Los Angeles, Ahmed and his tour mates, including Maz Jobrani and Tom Papa, handle religion, politics and other heavy matters with intelligence and a maximum of cool.
link.title: synopsis
The Axis of Evil Comedy Tour
Mr. Warmth: The Don Rickles Project
The Comedians of Comedy: The Movie

link.synopsis: The Cuylers are a down-on-their-luck hillbilly family living in rural Georgia. They also happen to be squids. This dark animated comedy from Adult Swim follows the aquatic clan as they negotiate life with little money and no bones. Unknown Hinson voices violent, drug-dealing patriarch Early, and Todd Hanson co-stars as sheetrock tycoon and shoddy furniture builder Dan Halen. Guest stars have included Fred Armisen, Patton Oswalt and Chad Ochocinco.
link.title: synopsis
Tim & Eric Awesome Show, Great Job!
Space Ghost Coast to Coast: Vol. 1
Space Ghost Coast to Coast: Vol. 2
South Park: A Very Buttery Collection
South Park: The Cult of Cartman
Family Guy Presents: Stewie Griffin: The Untold Story
South Park: The Passion of the Jew
The Man Show Boy / Household Hints from Adult Film Stars
The Man Show Presents: Girls on Trampolines

link.synopsis: One of the most influential sitcoms of all time -- focusing on the escapades of bus driver Ralph Kramden (Jackie Gleason), his wife, Alice (Audrey Meadows), and wacky neighbors Ed and Trixie Norton (Art Carney and Joyce Randolph) -- began as a series of skits on Gleason's live variety shows in the early 1950s. CBS aired a regular run of the show during the 1955-56 season, and a comedy legend about the foibles of marriage and friendship was born.
link.title: synopsis
The Very Best of the Honeymooners
The Life of Riley / Our Miss Brooks
Sergeant Preston of the Yukon: Season 2
The Pat Travers Band: Live: Hooked on Music

link.synopsis: Donna Reed stars in this vintage television comedy as unflappable, composed Donna Stone, an archetypal American mom and homemaker who lovingly cares for her family, including pediatrician hubby Alex (Carl Betz) and fresh-faced kids Mary (Shelley Fabares) and Jeff (Paul Petersen). As Mary copes with boy trouble, Jeff obsesses over sports and Alex searches for his inner domestic, Donna, in her pearls, always rises to a challenge.
link.title: synopsis
The Best of the Adventures of Ozzie & Harriet
Dean Martin & Jerry Lewis: Vol. 2: When Television Was Funny
The Life of Riley / Our Miss Brooks
The Adventures of Ozzie and Harriet: Vol. 9
The Loretta Young Show: Christina's Children Series
Sgt. Bilko: The Phil Silvers Show: Season 1
The Jack Benny Show: Collector's Edition
The Golden Age of TV Comedy
My Favorite Martian: Time Travelers Favorites
The Very Best of the Honeymooners
One Day at a Time: Season 1
I Love Lucy: Lucy's Really Lost Moments

link.synopsis: Twenty-somethings Gavin (Mathew Horne) and Stacey (Joanna Page) navigate an offbeat courtship in this BAFTA-winning BBC comedy series. The couple finally meet in person after a six-month long-distance courtship, but they must contend with friends and family who all have strong opinions about their love lives. Meanwhile, friends Smithy (James Corden) and Nessa (Ruth Jones) react like oil and water when they aren't in bed together.
link.title: synopsis
The Worst Week of My Life
The Life and Times of Vivienne Vyle
A Dance to the Music of Time
Tim & Eric Awesome Show, Great Job!
Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
The Vicar of Dibley: 10th Anniversary Specials
The Funny Blokes of British Comedy

link.synopsis: As part of a high-stakes mob investigation, the FBI assigns one of its agents to go undercover as a well-bred sorority member in this crime comedy. Miley Cyrus plays the agent, who soon finds out that her situation is far trickier than she thought.
link.title: synopsis
Big Shot: Confessions of a Campus Bookie
My Big Phat Hip Hop Family
Van Wilder 2: The Rise of Taj

link.synopsis: BET's long-running stand-up series has launched some of the best comic talent in America. This compilation of uncut, uncensored performances features Cedric the Entertainer, D.L. Hughley, Shang and Don "D.C." Curry among other comedy giants. Showcasing the brash, bawdy routines of jokers who've kept audiences howling with laughter year in and year out, this is raw entertainment at its best.

link.synopsis: Arnez J -- the comedian who's been dubbed "the black Jerry Lewis" for his physicality and charisma -- hosts this collection of hilarious moments from BET's showcase for urban comics. Sharing the laughs with Arnez are two of the stars from the "Queens of Comedy" tour -- Sommore and Mo'nique -- as well as that master of prank phone calls, Rickey Smiley.

Hughley and other great funnymen grace the stage -- in all their uncensored glory -- in this collection of riotous performances from "Comic View," which showcases the urban comedy world's hottest stand-up acts. Charismatic, larger-than-life Bruce Bruce hosts the raucous festivities in this installment of the hit series. Also on tap are quipsters Damon Williams and Rickey Smiley.

Among the talented performers on the roster are D.L. Hughley, Don "D.C." Curry (Next Friday), Miss Laura, Gary Owen, Sheryl Underwood and Kivi Rogers.

Curry, Shang, Cory "Zooman" Miller and other cutting-edge African-American comedians unleash their comic fury in these performances from the BET hit "Comic View," with special host Earthquake. Fasten your seat belt: These uncut and uncensored sets are designed for maximum comic impact. Since its inception in 1992, "Comic View" has become a staple of the urban comedy scene.

link.synopsis: On the night before graduating from college, straight-laced valedictorian Molly (Susanna Hoffs) searches for someone special to bed, Val (Dedee Pfeiffer) questions her current relationship and Gina (Joan Cusack) tries to record every precious moment on her video camera. Tamar Simon Hoffs (Susanna's mother) directs this beach party comedy that also stars John Terlesky and James Anthony Shanta as a pair of hunky surfer dudes.
link.title: synopsis
Revenge of the Nerds 2: Nerds in Paradise
Revenge of the Nerds III: The Next Generation

link.synopsis: Rosalind (Elisabeth Bergner), the daughter of a banished duke (Henry Ainley), loves Orlando (Laurence Olivier, in his first Shakespearian role on celluloid) -- the son of one of her father's courtiers. When Orlando ignores her to be with the exiled nobleman, Rosalind disguises herself as a male and follows Orlando in an effort to win him over. But her deception works a bit too well in this 1936 adaptation of William Shakespeare's classic comedy.
link.title: synopsis
Shakespeare Comedies: As You Like It
The Rise of Catherine the Great
St. Martin's Lane / Wings of the Morning: Double Feature
The Love Trap / Directed by William Wyler
Deanna Durbin: Three Smart Girls / Something in the Wind
I Met Him in Paris / Bluebeard's Eighth Wife
I Am a Fugitive from a Chain Gang
The Private Life of Henry VIII
The Roman Spring of Mrs. Stone
Thirty Day Princess / Kiss and Make Up

link.synopsis: Long before Thelma and Louise went on the lam, a pair of buxom go-go dancers named Lulu (Elizabeth Kaitan) and Peaches (Christina Whitaker) hit the road after being wrongly accused of murdering their boss. Halfway to Mexico, the girls add a forlorn passenger (Tammara Souza) to their giddy entourage and decide the desert is the perfect place for a makeover. Anita Rosenberg directed this campy comedy classic.
link.title: synopsis
One Shocking Moment / The Abnormal Female / Maidens of Fetish Street
The Toy Dolls: Our Last DVD?
Sorority Babes in the Slimeball Bowl-O-Rama
Kiss Me Quick / House on Bare Mountain
Who Framed Roger Rabbit?: Special Edition

link.synopsis: Twenty-five years after leaving his hometown and dropping the dime on his childhood tormentor, David Leary (Rick Moranis) returns a big-time writer. His old nemesis, "Fang" (Tom Arnold), has become the proverbial loser -- until David's homecoming reawakens Fang's inner bully. What follows is a series of increasingly hostile pranks that promises to settle the score once and for all in this comedy.
link.title: synopsis
Keep 'Em Flying / Ride 'Em Cowboy / Pardon My Sarong / Who Done It?
The Adventures of Rocky and Bullwinkle
The Flintstones in Viva Rock Vegas
Three Men and a Little Lady
Who Framed Roger Rabbit?: Special Edition

link.synopsis: Iconic porn star Marilyn Chambers (Behind the Green Door) doesn't do much stretching to play herself in this sexy comedy about a failing bistro and its staff of all-female employees who decide to adopt a revealing dress code to boost business. Taking a decidedly un-corporate approach to business attire, the ladies slip into skimpy two-pieces. Suddenly, they're selling a lot more than they can handle.
link.title: synopsis
Bikini Chain Gang / Bikini Airways: Double Feature
Bikini Girls from the Lost Planet
The Good, the Bad and the Beautiful / The Bikini Academy
Eating: A Very Serious Comedy About Women and Food
Romy and Michele's High School Reunion
I Love You, Don't Touch Me

link.synopsis: Shyam (Shammi Kapoor) is a crafty conman on the run from resolute cop Sunil (Dharmendra). To throw Sunil off his trail, Shyam hides out as an actor in a theater troupe. But Shyam finds himself in over his head when he falls in love with his striking leading lady, Sangeeta (Madhubala). Shyam will have to get the girl before he's carted off to jail in this screwball romantic comedy from Naresh Sehgal with music by Naresh Sehgal.
link.title: synopsis
Jis Desh Men Ganga Behti Hai

link.synopsis: Strange occurrences in an old English manor are turning the Otis family's dream vacation into a nightmare. But when the family finally meets the long-dead Sir Simon de Canterville (Richard Kiley), they discover just how cowardly a ghost can be. While Mr. and Mrs. Otis (Barry Van Dyke and Shelley Fabares) turn the tables on the terrified specter, their daughter, Virginia, tries to protect him. This breezy comedy is based on a story by Oscar Wilde.
link.title: synopsis
Peter & the Magic Egg / Dorothy in the Land of Oz
The Adventures of Ichabod and Mr. Toad
The Adventures of Elmo in Grouchland
Josh Kirby, Time Warrior: Trapped on Toy World
The Neverending Story 3: Escape From Fantasia
The Land Before Time VII: Stone of Cold Fire

link.synopsis: John Hughes, master of the 1980s teen ensemble movie, pens this comedy that captures its subjects 10 years after graduation. It's 1982, and Lizzie Borden High alums of all stripes -- doctors, mechanics, lawyers -- return for their class reunion. As some attempt to recapture their faded glory, into the mix jumps Walter Baylor (Gerrit Graham), a misfit who's desperate to fit in and will achieve his goal by any means necessary.
link.title: synopsis
National Lampoon: The Best of the Romp
Lost Reality 2: More of the Worst
National Lampoon Presents Jake's Booty Call
Shriek If You Know What I Did Last Friday the 13th

link.synopsis: With his final film -- a romantic comedy based on Charles Williams's novel "The Long Saturday Night" -- legendary director Francois Truffaut delivers a stylish tribute to Alfred Hitchcock, the "Master of Suspense." Julien Vercel (Jean-Louis Trintignant) is a real estate salesman accused of murdering his cheating wife and her lover. But can his resourceful secretary (Fanny Ardant) get to the bottom of the mystery before it's too late?
link.title: synopsis
Jean de Florette / Manon of the Spring
Agatha Christie's Evil Under the Sun
The Discreet Charm of the Bourgeoisie
The Diving Bell and the Butterfly

link.synopsis: In this crazy, twisted comedy from the notorious Troma Team, a quirky millionaire encounters various sordid characters through a series of run-ins. There's a murdered mistress, a country music singer, a poet -- even an overweight athlete! Add a whole lot of sex, and things get even more interesting. As madness prevails, a private detective (Allen Garfield) enters the picture to solve the mystery and identify the real killer!
link.title: synopsis
The Happy Hooker Goes to Washington
Tie Me Up! Tie Me Down!

link.synopsis: Stevenson Lowe (James Spader) is a book publisher with commitment issues in this romantic comedy. While Lowe's girlfriend (Polly Walker) wants to get married, he wants to buy a house -- without her! His new house, however, already has residents: the bickering ghosts of socialites Max Gale (Michael Caine) and Lily Marlowe (Maggie Smith). The couple offers Lowe all sorts of romantic advice, but why should he listen to them?
link.title: synopsis
World War II: When Lions Roared

link.synopsis: Bruce Beresford (Driving Miss Daisy) directed this 1976 black comedy that takes place at a party hosted by Don Henderson (John Hargreaves) to watch the televised returns of Australia's 1969 general election. As the evening wears on and the guests' alcohol consumption increases, their verbal barbs become more and more vicious. The evening eventually degenerates into sexual dalliances. Writer David Williamson adapted his own play.
link.title: synopsis
And Starring Pancho Villa as Himself
They Call Him Graveyard / Price of Honor
Run Swinger Run / Sex Club International
Del Tenney Double Feature: The Horror of Party Beach/The Curse of the Living Corpse
Monty Python and the Holy Grail
Monty Python's The Meaning of Life

link.synopsis: Three Generation-X couples struggle with commitment as one partner in each pair secretly pines for someone else. While some seek solace in denial, others find a release in casual sex -- until they all realize they must confront their true feelings. Heather Graham, James LeGros, Sarah Trigger, James Marshall, Sheryl Lee and Esai Morales star as the contemporary sextet in this romantic comedy from director Eugene Hess.
link.title: synopsis
Austin Powers: The Spy Who Shagged Me
Smiling Fish and Goat on Fire

link.synopsis: Yuen Biao stars in this family-oriented martial arts comedy in which a young monk from the Shaolin temple has numerous adventures on his way to the Great Wall on a quest for Buddha. The monk teams up with a street hustler kid to raise money by performing Shaolin kung fu demonstrations; later, he joins his brother and Vivian Hsu to rescue the head of a Buddha statue from the bad guys.
link.title: synopsis
Dragon Lee vs. The Five Brothers
Wu Tang Clan Presents: Fists of Legend 2: Iron Bodyguards
Once Upon a Time in China: The Next Chapters
Once Upon a Time in China
Once Upon a Time in China 3
The Legend of the Flying Swordsman

link.synopsis: After graduating from firefighting school, sexy new firefighters Barrett Hopkins (Gianna Ranaudo), Shannon Murphy (Martha Peterson) and Violet Brown (Renee Raiford) wind up working with a bunch of burned-out oddballs in the city's worst firehouse. But when a malicious businessman (Henry David Keeler) starts setting fires to run-down buildings in the neighborhood, the gorgeous trio goes into overdrive to expose the culprit in this raunchy comedy.
link.title: synopsis
See No Evil, Hear No Evil
Richard Pryor: Live on the Sunset Strip

link.synopsis: A Saturday night in Brooklyn turns chaotic for four friends after an accidental shooting in this edgy black comedy directed by Salvatore Stabile. One minute they're hanging out in Ray's (Michael Parducci) basement, and in the next Ray's older brother has been shot. Soon, the death count is at three, and the buddies are cruising the streets with a trunk-load of corpses, unsure of what's happened or what to do next.
link.title: synopsis
The Astonishing Work of Tezuka Osamu
Bloody Mama / A Bucket of Blood
The Gospel According to St. Matthew

link.synopsis: Jackie Chan turns kung fu inside out with this martial-arts action comedy. Chan plays Jiang, an amiable but bungling ne'er-do-well who cons his way into a servant's job at a mansion. Then he mistakenly masquerades as the "Whip Hero," a renowned outlaw whose defense of choice is to plaster his opponents with eggs! This goofy parody made Chan a star.
link.title: synopsis
Jackie Chan: The Kung Fu Years / Force 5 / The Power of Aikido / Dr. Wai
Black Dragon Collection: Of Cooks and Kung Fu
Crash Masters: The Dragon, the Hero
Rarescope: Choi Lee Fut Kung Fu

title.regular: Half a Loaf of Kung Fu
title.short: Half a Loaf of Kung Fu

link.synopsis: Produced by Independence Day director Roland Emmerich, this low-budget sci-fi comedy begins with a trio of English knights (John Rhys-Davies, Michael Des Barres and Rick Overton) preparing for the Crusades. When an alien spaceship lands by their camp, however, they commandeer it, ordering the pilots to fly them to Jerusalem. When they end up at the aliens' planet instead, the angry crusaders decide to put the entire planet to the sword.
link.title: synopsis
Star Trek VI: The Undiscovered Country
Mom and Dad Save the World
War of the Worlds 2: The Next Wave
Star Trek III: The Search for Spock
Flash Gordon: The Deadly Ray from Mars
Flash Gordon: Spaceship to the Unknown

link.synopsis: &NFb;&NFb_;James Belushi stars as maverick vice cop Thomas Dooley, who's been fervently pursuing an elusive drug dealer (Kevin Tighe) for two years. After Dooley's car gets blown to bits during a stakeout, he requests a new vehicle and instead finds himself paired with a new partner: a feisty German shepherd named Jerry Lee. Can the dogged duo collar the cocaine kingpin? Mel Harris and Ed O'Neill costar in this charming comedy.
link.title: synopsis
See No Evil, Hear No Evil
How to Beat the High Cost of Living
The King of the Wild Horses

link.synopsis: Goldie Hawn stars in this 1979 screwball comedy as Anita, an impulsive American actress who embarks on a whirlwind affair with charming Italian banker Guido Massacesi (Giancarlo Giannini) while vacationing in Rome. It all begins when Guido meets Anita at the home of his former lover and persuades her to join him on a trip out of town to tend to a family crisis. Claudine Auger and Aurore Clément co-star.
link.title: synopsis
The Black Belly of the Tarantula
Elvira's Movie Macabre: Frankenstein's Castle of Freaks
The Giallo Collection: The Bloodstained Shadow
Lucio Fulci: The House by the Cemetery
All the Colors of the Dark

link.synopsis: David (Robert Petkoff), a med school dropout, agrees to help two women he meets on a New York street in this independent feature from Michael Bergmann. The resulting screwball comedy includes David's encounter with a homeless cattle expert (Peter Boyle) and the delivery of 21 milk cows to a Central Park West penthouse. Calista Flockhart makes an early screen appearance as a rich man's mistress (who has a doctorate in medieval literature).
link.title: synopsis
The Last of the Blonde Bombshells
The Incredibly True Adventure of 2 Girls in Love

link.synopsis: An impoverished artist discovers he's purchased a winning lottery ticket at the moment his creditors come to collect. Unfortunately, the ticket is in the pocket of his threadbare coat, which he left in his less-than-reliable girlfriend's apartment. Next thing you know, she gives the coat to a man hiding from the police, who sells it to an opera singer for a performance in this influential, inventive screwball comedy directed by René Clair.
link.title: synopsis
Earth / The End of St. Petersburg / Chess Fever
Tabu: A Story of the South Seas
I Am a Fugitive from a Chain Gang
The Discreet Charm of the Bourgeoisie

link.synopsis: Blending horror, comedy and plenty of high-octane martial arts action, this Hong Kong classic tells the story of a Taoist priest, Master Gau (Ching-Ying Lam), who tries to save his two apprentices, Chou (Siu-hou Chin) and Man Choi (Ricky Hui), from supernatural forces. While working to help a family resolve its ongoing bad luck, Chou becomes possessed by a ghost, while Man Choi meets a sexy bloodsucker who's turning him into a vampire.
link.title: synopsis
Martial Arts Master Wong Fei Hung
God of Gamblers III: Back to Shanghai
Buffy the Vampire Slayer: The Movie
Operation Condor 2: Armour of the Gods
Shaolin vs. Evil Dead: Ultimate Power

link.synopsis: This tuneful comedy is based loosely on the life of irrepressible silent-movie star Pearl White (played to the hilt by Betty Hutton). The film follows White from her humble beginnings as a frustrated sweatshop worker to her days on the road with a repertory company to her worldwide fame as queen of the serials. William Demarest co-stars as stentorian director George "Mac" McGuire, and John Lund portrays Mike Farrington, White's love interest.
link.title: synopsis
Nomads of the North / The Shock
Birth of the Blues / Blue Skies: Double Feature
The Mummy's Ghost / The Mummy's Curse
My Friend Irma / My Friend Irma Goes West
W.C. Fields Comedy Collection: You Can't Cheat an Honest Man
W.C. Fields Comedy Collection: The Bank Dick

link.synopsis: After ditzy D.C. cocktail waitress Sunny Davis (Goldie Hawn) single-handedly saves an Arab dignitary from an assassination attempt, she becomes an overnight media darling in this lighthearted comedy from director Herbert Ross. Soon, White House bureaucrats hire her to work in the protocol office, and Sunny earnestly navigates her new role. But when she discovers she's being used as a political pawn, she sends global diplomacy into a tailspin.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: In this action-packed Hong Kong comedy, Wilson Bond (Stephen Chow) makes extra cash telling funny stories in his sister's brothel. When officials raid the place for rebels, Wilson saves the leader and becomes one of them. He then ends up posing as a servant, and as a kung fu expert, he attempts to find a hidden Manchu treasure. Wilson's act fools everyone, including the emperor of China, who enlists Wilson in a dangerous mission.
link.title: synopsis
God of Gamblers III: Back to Shanghai
The Jet Li Collection: Evil Cult / Dr. Wai
My Wife Is a Gambling Maestro
Wu Tang Clan Presents: Fists of Legend 2: Iron Bodyguards

link.synopsis: The snow hits the fan when advertising executive Scott Calvin accidentally kills Santa and suddenly finds himself saddled with jolly Saint Nick's job. While initially a Scrooge, Scott eventually becomes a true believer in this merry family comedy.
link.title: synopsis
Robbie the Reindeer in Hooves of Fire and the Legend of the Lost Tribe
The Neverending Story 3: Escape From Fantasia

link.synopsis: Voting against the Mafia in what he thinks is a secret ballot costs Sicilian laborer Mimi (Giancarlo Giannini) his livelihood in Lina Wertmuller's dark comedy. He leaves his wife, flees to Turin and romances a Communist organizer (Mariangela Melato) -- but he just can't shake the Mafia. When they lure Mimi back to Sicily with a better job, he must keep his lover -- and love child -- under wraps. That's when his wife announces she's pregnant.
link.title: synopsis
The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring
The Black Belly of the Tarantula
The Three Musketeers of the West
What Have You Done to Solange?
Monty Python's And Now for Something Completely Different

link.synopsis: Produced by the notorious Troma Studios, this shlock-horror comedy begins when bumbling New York cop Sgt. Harry Griswold (Rick Gianasi) is transformed into a Japanese kabuki actor with magical powers. Using poisonous sushi and throwing chopsticks with pinpoint accuracy, he fights not only crime and corruption in Manhattan but also a malevolent force (known only as the Evil One) bent on world destruction.
link.title: synopsis
Citizen Toxie: The Toxic Avenger IV
Primitive Love / Mondo Balordo: Double Feature
Wrestling Society X: The Complete First (and Last) Season
Scorpions:  Live at Wacken Open Air 2006
Who Framed Roger Rabbit?: Special Edition

link.synopsis: Charlie Chaplin plays a street-smart con artist in this silent film -- Hollywood's first feature-length comedy. Charlie woos a country girl named Tillie (Marie Dressler), convincing her to take her father's money and run off to the city with him. Once there, Charlie leaves Tillie and goes back to his old sweetie (Mabel Normand). Charlie eventually returns, but his wandering eye sends everyone into an uproarious pie-tossing frenzy.
link.title: synopsis
One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest
Monty Python's And Now for Something Completely Different
Parisian Love / Down to the Sea in Ships: Double Feature
Why Change Your Wife? / Miss Lulu Bett
Don't Change Your Husband / The Golden Chance
The Little Tramp: The Charlie Chaplin Collection

link.synopsis: Whatever your musical preference, Del's jaunt through Flooby Nooby is a lyrical tribute to popular American music. This surrealistic, animated musical comedy is a tribute to American popular music from renowned award-winning animator, author and filmmaker Bill Plympton. The music for The Tune was composed by Maureen McElheron.
link.title: synopsis
Bill's Dirty Shorts: A Collection of Bill Plympton's Naughty Cartoons
Spike & Mike's Sick & Twisted Festival of Animation: Contagious
Spike and Mike's Sick & Twisted Festival of Animation
Spike & Mike's Classic Festival of Animation
Avoid Eye Contact: Vol. 2: NYC Independent Animation
When Willie Comes Marching Home / Up the River
Chesterfield Kings: Where is the Chesterfield King?
My Favorite Broadway: The Leading Ladies
Give My Regards to Broad Street
Sweeney Todd: The Demon Barber of Fleet Street

link.synopsis: Peter Sellers plays a pompous retired general who still has a taste for the ladies in this lusty comedy of manners from French playwright Jean Anouilh, who tempers his treatment of the old rake's delusions with generous dollops of wit and compassion. Although this film's frank subject matter initially shocked British audiences and critics, it eventually ushered in a new openness in the depiction of sexuality.
link.title: synopsis
The Prime of Miss Jean Brodie
A Hard Day's Night: Collector's Series
The Wrong Arm of the Law
There's a Girl in My Soup
The Knack...and How to Get It
An Ideal Husband / Lady Windermere's Fan

link.synopsis: Chef Stella James (Sean Young) has two passions, preparing food and seducing men. When she leaves her empty existence for a new start in Los Angeles, Stella finds herself on a journey of sexual awakening that blasts the double standards that envelop her. But Stella will soon learn there's more to love than just sex. Keith Odett and Dylan Walsh also star in this comedy from Zoe Clarke-Williams based on the novel by Margaret Diehl.
link.title: synopsis
Like a Fish Out of Water
Frankenstein vs. the Creature from Blood Cove
Mating Habits of the Earthbound Human

link.synopsis: In this feel-good romantic comedy, three ambitious college graduates search for love in the gay community and success in New York City. Robert (Aaron Williams) is secretly smitten with his best friend, Marc (Michael Shawn Lucas), an aspiring actor. Robert's straight, shopaholic buddy, Cynthia (Mara Hobel), urges him to reveal his feelings for Marc. But as it happens, Marc has a crush of his own. Meanwhile, Cynthia runs into money problems.
link.title: synopsis
Midnight in the Garden of Good and Evil

link.synopsis: American Dylan (Dan Futterman) and Brit Jez (Stuart Townsend), childhood friends from opposite sides of the pond, reconnect in London as young adults to con England's wealthy into financing a home for deserving orphans: themselves! But when Dylan and Jez hire enigmatic medical student Georgie (Kate Beckinsale) as their secretary, they get ensnared in a hilariously complex net as she steals their hearts in this breezy British comedy.
link.title: synopsis
The Fast and the Furious: Tokyo Drift

link.synopsis: Writer-director Tom DiCillo lampoons the entertainment industry in this character-driven comedy about Joe (Matthew Modine), an idealistic -- and perpetually out-of-work -- actor, and his girlfriend Mary (Catherine Keener), a successful makeup artist. Eventually, a casting agent (Kathleen Turner) convinces Joe to swallow his pride, and he takes an embarrassing bit part in a Madonna video -- only to be fired after arguing with the assistant director.
link.title: synopsis
Tristram Shandy: A Cock and Bull Story
Sex and the City: The Movie
How to Lose Friends & Alienate People

link.synopsis: In this black comedy, Harry Odum lives under his mother's thumb as well as under her roof. Although a devoted son, Harry has a mean streak, which he unleashes on a strip-club owner. When a member of the Jewish mob hears of this, he recruits Harry.
link.title: synopsis
Just for the Hell of It / Blast-Off Girls

link.synopsis: Lester Grimm (Eric Stoltz) can't control the jealousy he feels toward Dashiell Frank (Chris Eigeman), the best-selling author ex of his gal, Ramona (Annabella Sciorra). He takes his unfettered insecurity issues to a new level when he goes undercover to attend Dashiell's group therapy sessions. Writer-director Noah Baumbach's romantic comedy co-stars Bridget Fonda, who plays Dashiell's current squeeze, Irene.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: Former gangster Bill Manucci (James Belushi) is part of the federal Witness Protection Program, hiding in the small, redneck town of Harmony. But his reconstructed life falls apart when he successfully pulls off a multimillion-dollar heist. Thanks to the questionable loyalties of Manucci's wife (Vanessa Angel), he soon finds himself on the run from four mobsters and corrupt lawman Dex Drier (Timothy Dalton) in this fast-paced, action comedy.
link.title: synopsis
The Mafia: An Expose - Coming to America/Al Capone
Rest in Peace, Mrs. Columbo / Uneasy Lies the Crown

link.synopsis: Hoping to take advantage of an unwritten code that any student whose roommate commits suicide will automatically receive straight A's, troublemaking roomies Josh Miller (Tom Everett Scott) and Cooper Frederickson (Mark-Paul Gosselaar) search for a classmate with a death wish. Director Alan Cohn's dark comedy follows Josh and Cooper as they home in on Cliff O'Malley (Lochlyn Munro), a promisingly unstable student.
link.title: synopsis
Revenge of the Nerds 2: Nerds in Paradise
Revenge of the Nerds III: The Next Generation

link.synopsis: Geno (Joey Travolta) is a no-talent singer down on his luck in Sin City when a small-time Mafioso makes him an offer he can't refuse: Kill a bookie in exchange for cash. Geno reluctantly accepts, but just as he's about to do the deed, he wimps out. Later, when the bookie actually turns up dead, Geno finds himself framed for the crime. Now, it's up to his three goofball buddies to save his neck in this comedy co-starring Jeff Conaway.
link.title: synopsis
I Really, Really Like You: Vol. 1
The Cheerleaders Collection: Revenge of the Cheerleaders
What's the Worst That Could Happen?
Bare Wench 3: The Path of the Wicked
Dumb and Dumberer: When Harry Met Lloyd
Buffy the Vampire Slayer: The Movie
The Adventures of Priscilla, Queen of the Desert

link.synopsis: Kendall (Patricia Royce) just got dumped by her boyfriend, David (J.D. Souther). But it's nothing that a much younger rock musician -- and the advice of her best friend (and David's ex-), Claire (Lorraine Devon) -- couldn't fix. Only problem is, Claire and David have rekindled their lost romance. Now, Claire and Kendall's friendship is put to the ultimate test as they try to help each other decipher men and love in this romantic comedy.
link.title: synopsis
Eating: A Very Serious Comedy About Women and Food
I Love You, Don't Touch Me

link.synopsis: Equal portions prankster, browbeaten public pariah and schmaltzy sap, Charlie Chaplin's appeal lies not only in his ingenious farce but in his flouting of authority, status and custom. Every comedy short Chaplin helmed at Mutual Studios turns into a funnyman seminar as he explores the slapstick potential of a hodgepodge of props and circumstances. Volume 1 includes "The Immigrant," "The Adventurer," "The Cure" and "Easy Street."
link.title: synopsis
The Harold Lloyd Comedy Collection: Vol. 2
Nomads of the North / The Shock
The Little Tramp: The Charlie Chaplin Collection
Slapstick Symposium: The Harold Lloyd Collection 2
Slapstick Symposium: The Harold Lloyd Collection

link.synopsis: Equal portions prankster, browbeaten public pariah and schmaltzy sap, Charlie Chaplin's appeal lies not only in his ingenious farce but in his flouting of authority, status and custom. Every comedy short Chaplin helmed at Mutual Studios turns into a funnyman seminar as he explores the slapstick potential of a hodgepodge of props and circumstances. Volume 2 includes "The Count," "The Vagabond," "The Fireman" and "Behind the Screen."
link.title: synopsis
The Three Stooges: All the World's a Stooge
Old Wives for New / The Whispering Chorus
The Little Tramp: The Charlie Chaplin Collection
The King of the Wild Horses

link.synopsis: Equal portions prankster, browbeaten public pariah and schmaltzy sap, Charlie Chaplin's appeal lies not only in his ingenious farce but in his flouting of authority, status and custom. Every comedy short Chaplin helmed at Mutual Studios turns into a funnyman seminar as he explores the slapstick potential of a hodgepodge of props and circumstances. Volume 3 includes "One A.M.," "The Pawn Shop," "The Floorwalker" and "The Rink."
link.title: synopsis
W.C. Fields Comedy Collection: The Bank Dick
The Little Tramp: The Charlie Chaplin Collection
The King of the Wild Horses

link.synopsis: When Max (David Schwimmer), a womanizing sportscaster, falls hard for Samantha (Mili Avital), a lovely book editor, he proposes to her after just two weeks. But as the wedding nears, Max panics and asks his best friend (Jason Lee) to test the relationship by asking Samantha out. Will all these shenanigans result in a marriage? And if so, whose? This featherweight romantic comedy offers sitcom-style fun and endearing performances.
link.title: synopsis
Three Men and a Little Lady

link.synopsis: "Seinfeld" co-creator Larry David directed this quirky comedy about the erosion of family values. While vacationing in Atlantic City, N.J., cousins Richie (Craig Bierko) and Evan (Steven Weber) court Lady Luck without much to show for it. But when Richie borrows two quarters from Evan to play the slot machines -- and wins a jackpot of more than $400,000 -- Richie's refusal to share the payoff leads to a full-blown family feud.
link.title: synopsis
Can She Bake a Cherry Pie?
Oakland A's Vintage World Series Film
Romy and Michele's High School Reunion
Jay and Silent Bob Strike Back
Tenacious D in: The Pick of Destiny

link.synopsis: Fans of comic opera rejoice! Under the baton of conductor Ricardo Muti, the renowned Teatro La Scala (including Alessandro Corbelli, Nuccia Focile and Amelia Felle) performs Giovanni Battista Pergolesi's nearly forgotten 18th century baroque comedy of romantic mishaps and mix-ups. High production values and impressive vocal and musical talent add luster to this tale of three arranged (or misarranged) marriages.
link.title: synopsis
Gioacchino Rossini: La Scala di Seta
Wagner: Lohengrin: Staged by Werner Herzog
The Other Side of the Bed
The Barber of Seville: Rossini: Netherlands Opera
Destination Mozart: A Night at the Opera with Peter Sellars
Angela Gheorghiu: Art of Angela Gheorghiu
Alfredo Kraus: Live in Las Palmas 1995

link.synopsis: This PBS-produced documentary charts the career of the legendary Marx Brothers comedy team, from their beginnings on the vaudeville circuit to their final performances on television programs and commercials during the 1950s and early '60s. Narrated by Leslie Nielsen, the program features interviews with surviving family members, long-lost film clips, newsreel footage and rare home movies.
link.title: synopsis
The Work of Director Spike Jonze
Buffy the Vampire Slayer: The Movie

link.synopsis: In this courtroom comedy set in 1899 China, Chan (Stephen Chow) is a smart lawyer and a great practical joker, but his assistant (and frequent victim), Foon (Eric Kot), has had enough. He heads to Hong Kong but immediately finds trouble on the island, which has just fallen under British rule. Chan rushes to his aid but can't play it straight long enough to get them out of trouble, forcing his wife (Karen Mok) to try to save them.
link.title: synopsis
God of Gamblers III: Back to Shanghai
Over the Rainbow, Under the Skirt
Once Upon a Time in China

link.synopsis: Dhawan/Govinda comedy banks on a simpleton who leaves behind a girl to pursue asinging career in the city. After finding a new romance, his former girlfriend, thought to be dead, turns up.
link.title: synopsis
Kyo Kii... Main Jhuth Nahin Bolta
Love Ke Liye Kuch Bhi Karega

link.synopsis: The groovy pink cat's popularity lives on in this collection of short films featuring "Jet Pink," as well as seven other animated adventures. The Pink Panther has starred in dozens of animated short films since making his screen debut in 1964. The colorful feline character was created and developed by legendary animator Friz Freleng and producer David H. DePatie for the opening credits of the Peter Sellers comedy of the same name.
link.title: synopsis
